intro: Smelowskia mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of Mongolia and adjacent regions. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and thrives in dry, well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. Smelowskia mongolica is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
